item.title: Endowment Structure, Threshold Level, and Belief Formation
item.description:
• Designed a laboratory experiment with the framework of threshold public goods provision
  • Analyzed the interaction effect of endowment structure and threshold level to contribution level of public good pool.
  • Discussed intermediary effect about belief and mechanism of belief formation.

item.title: Gender Ratio, Asset Allocation, and Elderly Retirement Arrangement
item.description:
• Using CFPS database to explore relationship between elderly retirement arrangement and gender ratio of their children.
  • Using national census data to construct Iv for gender ratio variable.
  • Preliminary analysis suggests that with higher gender ratio of their children, people of retirement age tend to continue to work instead of retire. Also, families with higher gender ratio have significantly higher house loan than those with lower gender ratio of children.

item.title: Pension Cost, Income Structure and Expenditure of Children's Pension Service
item.description:
• Designed a laboratory experiment with the framework of threshold public goods to simulate a strategy interaction scenario between children within a family. Investigated the impacts of threshold level and endowment structure on the financial assistance provided by children to parents.
  • Discussed interaction effect between the elderly care cost and the income structure of children. Further explored underlying mechanism of social norms in the relationship between intergenerational support and social support.

item.title: Why Peers Matter: How Friendship Network Affects Students' Academic Performance
Main-Organizer of Multi-Universities Academic Seminar
item.description:
In my senior year of college, my professor initiated an economic seminar involving different universities professors and students. Breaking the limits of distance of various universities, we chose to run seminars online.

Generally, we have 3 types of seminars:

  • Working paper workshop
  • Lectures on specific topics
  • Paper study & review talking

As for research fields, we have topics about:

  • Behavioral Economics
  • Experimental Economics
  • Machine Learning
  • Labor Economics
  • Macroeconomic Development
  • ……

The seminar was called Taichi Biweekly Seminar. Taichi is a kind of traditional Chinese martial art, containing Chinese philosophical principles of inclusion and further development. Similarly, we aimed to introduce cutting-edge economic knowledge to groups interested in Economics, gather complement of advantages of different methods, and then help to tell Chinese stories better.

As the main organizer of the seminar, my responsibilities involve:

  • Organize and schedule reporters for each seminar.
  • Coordinate and assign relative professors to comment.
  • Make, modify, and distribute posters for publicity.
  • Co-host and record seminars for further achiving and summary.

By now, I have organized and coordinated 100+ participants from 15+ universities to hold 50 seminars.

item.title: Co-Founder of Economic Knowledge Sharing Platform
item.description:
In my sophomore year, my friend and I found that there were few official account in Wechat targeted for sharing economic knowledge, so with the guidance of Professor Zhou, we established an online economic papers sharing platform Beyond Economics.

We not only wanted to found an account to spread specific academic knowledge to the public, but also build the bridge of information connecting people who are devoted to academic fields of economics.

Generally, our pushes(tweets) include fields of both microeconomics and macroeconomics and involve:

  • Summary of classic dissertations
  • Summative translation articles for frontier papers

With efforts, we have accumulated over 3,500 followers and expanded into an academic group with over 50 article writing contributors. I am glad to make contributions to better access to academic resourses and higher popularity of academic discussion among university students.

item.title: Co-Founder and Main Leader of Volunteer Service Group
item.description:
As a girl living in a mountain village, I never go outside of my hometown until I entered University. Once I lived in Beijing, I felt frustrated about my narrow horizon and low comprehensive abilities. There is a too wide information gap between metropolises and small towns. Coincidentally, some friends also encountered similar puzzles in university. We were from top universities of China (including Renmin univ., Tsinghua Univ., Fudan Univ., Zhejiang Univ.,Tianjin Univ., and Harbin Institute of Technology), but we were suffering from lack of confidence in our campus life.

This experience got me thinking of high school students in my hometown, who lack opportunities to see the world outside of the mountains. They may experience similar dilemmas in their future, maybe we can help them pursue better education using our information, ability, and experiences. So, after preparation, we together founded The Dreamer.

The Dreamer is a non-profit organization aiming to support education development in my hometown.We recruited college student volunteers, and then taught high school students in the hometown. By now, we have implemented 8 sessions of supporting teaching activities during vacations. 300+ volunteers and 800+ students participated accumulatively.

As the main leader of 5 sessions of activities, I spent almost all my summer vocations and winter vocations organizing and participating volunteering activities.Although busy and full of arrangements, I felt happy and content every time I saw faces of students in the classroom.

Generally, I arranged 4 kinds of volunteering activities to students:

  • Courses teaching 9 disciplines from freshman year to senior year in high school.
  • Lectures on expansion of horizons,including introduction of cutting-edge technology, computer operation skills, appreciation of poetry, and so on.
  • Lectures on preparation experiences of College Entrance Examination and introduction of main majors and university life.
  • Provision of self-learning guidance and supervision for students who don’t choose relative courses.

To provide activities efficiently, we have 4 main groups:

  • Group of Publicity, responsible for managing social media online, distributing posters offline, and recruiting students.
  • Group of Teaching Service, responsible for recruiting teaching volunteers, coordinating schedule and content of teaching in different grades, and arranging self-learning issues.
  • Group of Lecture Service, responsible for arranging schedule, connecting lecturers, and preparing & summarizing the process of lectures.
  • Group of Logistics Support, responsible for assisting matters in other groups when necessary.

As the main leader, I am responsible for coordinating volunteers in these groups and making important decisions including:

  • Seeking sponsoring and assistance from local government and high schools for necessary subsides and sites support.
  • Arranging jobs for different groups.
  • Revising push content published in Wechat Official Account and posters for publicity.
  • ……

With our efforts, The organization was awarded the Best Volunteer Group by local government in 2019. More importantly, we have received countless thanks from students and their parents for contributions we make for high school education development. More and more students we taught volunteer to be a member of Dreamer when they enter university. I am so proud of making some contributions for a better future of my hometown.
